original: Yassa puggalassa saha udāhaṭavelāya dhammābhisamayo hoti—
analyzed: yassa puggalassa saha udāhaṭa velāya dhamma abhisamayaḥ hoti
translated: There is the person who has a breakthrough to the Dhamma when the teaching is given in brief.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “ugghaṭitaññū”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ ugghaṭita ññū
translated: This is called a person who is quick-witted.

original: Katamo ca puggalo vipañcitaññū?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ
translated: And who is the person who is reflective?

original: Yassa puggalassa saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthe vibhajiyamāne dhammābhisamayo hoti—
analyzed: yassa puggalassa saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthe vibhajiyamāne dhamma abhisamayaḥ hoti
translated: There is the person who has a breakthrough to the Dhamma when the meaning of the brief statements is analyzed in detail.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “vipañcitaññū”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ
translated: This is called a person who is reflective.

original: Katamo ca puggalo neyyo?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ neyyaḥ
translated: And who is the person who is guided?

original: Yassa puggalassa uddesato paripucchato yoniso manasikaroto kalyāṇamitte sevato bhajato payirupāsato evaṁ anupubbena dhammābhisamayo hoti—
analyzed: yassa puggalassa uddesataḥ paripucchataḥ yonisas manasikarotaḥ kalyāṇa mitte sevataḥ bhajataḥ payirupāsataḥ evam anupubbena dhamma abhisamayaḥ hoti
translated: There is the person who has a breakthrough to the Dhamma by gradually learning the teachings, asking questions, discerning the meaning, and seeing the meaning.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “neyyo”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ neyyaḥ
translated: This is called a person who is guided.

original: Katamo ca puggalo padaparamo?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ pada paramaḥ
translated: And who is the person who is one who attains by searching?

original: Yassa puggalassa bahumpi suṇato bahumpi bhaṇato bahumpi dhārayato bahumpi vācayato na tāya jātiyā dhammābhisamayo hoti—
analyzed: yassa puggalassa bahumpi suṇataḥ bahumpi bhaṇataḥ bahumpi dhārayataḥ bahumpi vācayataḥ na tāya jātiyā dhamma abhisamayaḥ hoti
translated: There is the person who, though he listens to much, speaks much, remembers much, and recites much, does not attain the true way in this life.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “padaparamo”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ pada paramaḥ
translated: This is called the person who is “at the level of words.”

original: Katamo ca puggalo yuttappaṭibhāno no muttappaṭibhāno?🔽Idhekacco puggalo pañhaṁ puṭṭho samāno yuttaṁ vadati no sīghaṁ—
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ yutta paṭibhānaḥ no mutta ppaṭibhānaḥ  idha ekaccaḥ puggalo pañham puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ yuttam vadati no sīgha
translated: “What is the person who is coherent but not fluent?🔽There is the person who, when asked a question, answers coherently but not quickly.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “yuttappaṭibhāno no muttappaṭibhāno”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ yutta paṭibhānaḥ no mutta ppaṭibhānaḥ
translated: This is called the person who is “coherent but not fluent.”

original: Katamo ca puggalo muttappaṭibhāno no yuttappaṭibhāno?🔽Idhekacco puggalo pañhaṁ puṭṭho samāno sīghaṁ vadati no yuttaṁ—
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ mutta paṭibhānaḥ no yutta ppaṭibhānaḥ  idha ekaccaḥ puggalo pañham puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ sīgham vadati no yutta
translated: “What is the person who is fluent but not coherent?🔽There is the person who, when asked a question, answers quickly but not coherently.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “muttappaṭibhāno no yuttappaṭibhāno”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ mutta paṭibhānaḥ no yutta ppaṭibhānaḥ
translated: This is called the person who is “fluent but not coherent.”

original: Katamo ca puggalo yuttappaṭibhāno ca muttappaṭibhāno ca?🔽Idhekacco puggalo pañhaṁ puṭṭho samāno yuttañca vadati sīghañca—
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ yutta paṭibhāno ca mutta ppaṭibhāno ca  idha ekaccaḥ puggalo pañham puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ yuttam ca vadati sīgham ca
translated: “What is the person who is both coherent and fluent?🔽There is the person who, when asked a question, answers both coherently and quickly.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “yuttappaṭibhāno ca muttappaṭibhāno ca”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ yutta ppaṭibhāno ca mutta ppaṭibhāno ca
translated: This is called the person who is “both coherent and fluent.”

original: Katamo ca puggalo neva yuttappaṭibhāno no muttappaṭibhāno?🔽Idhekacco puggalo pañhaṁ puṭṭho samāno neva yuttaṁ vadati no sīghaṁ—
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ na iva yutta paṭibhānaḥ no mutta ppaṭibhānaḥ  idha ekaccaḥ puggalo pañham puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ na iva yuttam vadati no sīgha
translated: “Which is the person who is neither quick-witted nor fluent?🔽It’s the person who, when asked a question, doesn’t answer right away or quickly.

original: ayaṁ vuccati, puggalo “neva yuttappaṭibhāno no muttappaṭibhāno”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ na iva yutta ppaṭibhānaḥ no mutta ppaṭibhānaḥ
translated: This is called the person who is neither quick-witted nor fluent.

original: Tattha katame cattāro dhammakathikā puggalā?
analyzed: tattha katame cattāro dhamma kathikā puggalā
translated: “Now, what are the four kinds of people who expound the Teaching?

original: Idhekacco dhammakathiko appañca bhāsati asahitañca, parisā cassa na kusalā hoti sahitāsahitassa.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ dhamma kathikaḥ appañca bhāsati asahitañca parisā cassa na kusalā hoti sahita asahitassa
translated: There is the case where a certain expounder of the Teaching speaks little & unskillfully. The assembly is unskilled in discerning what is skillful & unskillful.

original: Evarūpo dhammakathiko evarūpāya parisāya dhammakathikotveva saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
analyzed: evarūpaḥ dhamma kathikaḥ evarūpāya parisāya dhamma kathikaḥ utu eva saṅkham gacchati
translated: Such an expounder of the Teaching is reckoned as a certain kind of expounder of the Teaching in regard to such an assembly.

original: Idha panekacco dhammakathiko appañca bhāsati sahitañca, parisā cassa kusalā hoti sahitāsahitassa.
analyzed: idha pana ekaccaḥ dhamma kathikaḥ appañca bhāsati sahitañca parisā ca ssa kusalā hoti sahita asahitassa
translated: There is the case where a certain expounder of the Teaching speaks little & skillfully. The assembly is skilled in discerning what is skillful & unskillful.

original: Evarūpo dhammakathiko evarūpāya parisāya dhammakathikotveva saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
analyzed: evarūpaḥ dhamma kathikaḥ evarūpāya parisāya dhamma kathikaḥ utu eva saṅkham gacchati
translated: Such an expounder of the Teaching is reckoned as a certain kind of expounder of the Teaching in regard to such an assembly.

original: Idha panekacco dhammakathiko bahuñca bhāsati asahitañca, parisā cassa na kusalā hoti sahitāsahitassa.
analyzed: idha pana ekaccaḥ dhamma kathikaḥ bahuñca bhāsati asahitañca parisā ca ssa na kusalā hoti sahita asahitassa
translated: There is the case where a certain expounder of the Teaching speaks much & unskillfully. The assembly is unskilled in discerning what is skillful & unskillful.

original: Evarūpo dhammakathiko evarūpāya parisāya dhammakathikotveva saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
analyzed: evarūpaḥ dhamma kathikaḥ evarūpāya parisāya dhamma kathikaḥ utu eva saṅkham gacchati
translated: Such a preacher of the Dhamma is reckoned as a preacher of the Dhamma in such an assembly.

original: Idha panekacco dhammakathiko bahuñca bhāsati sahitañca, parisā cassa kusalā hoti sahitāsahitassa.
analyzed: idha pana ekaccaḥ dhamma kathikaḥ bahuñca bhāsati sahitañca parisā ca ssa kusalā hoti sahita asahitassa
translated: “Here someone speaks much and is coherent, but his assembly is unskilled in coherent and incoherent talk.

original: Evarūpo dhammakathiko evarūpāya parisāya dhammakathikotveva saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
analyzed: evarūpaḥ dhamma kathikaḥ evarūpāya parisāya dhamma kathikaḥ utu eva saṅkham gacchati
translated: Such a preacher of the Dhamma is reckoned as a preacher of the Dhamma in such an assembly.

original: Ime cattāro “dhammakathikā puggalā”.
analyzed: ime cattāro dhamma kathikā puggalā
translated: These are the four kinds of persons similar to preachers of the Dhamma.

original: Tattha katame cattāro valāhakūpamā puggalā?
analyzed: tattha katame cattāraḥ valāhaka upamā puggalā
translated: “Herein, what are the four kinds of persons similar to clouds?

original: Cattāro valāhakā—
analyzed: cattāraḥ valāhakā
translated: There are four kinds of clouds:

analyzed: gajjitā no vassitā vassitā no gajjitā gajjitā ca vassitā ca na iva gajjitā no vassitā
translated: those that thunder but do not rain, those that rain but do not thunder, those that both thunder and rain, and those that neither thunder nor rain.

original: Evamevaṁ cattārome valāhakūpamā puggalā santo saṁvijjamānā lokasmiṁ.
analyzed: evam evam cattāro me valāhaka upamā puggalā santaḥ sa vijjamānā lokasmi
translated: So too, there are four kinds of persons similar to clouds found in the world.

original: Katame cattāro?
analyzed: katame cattāro
translated: What are the four?

original: Gajjitā no vassitā, vassitā no gajjitā, gajjitā ca vassitā ca, neva gajjitā no vassitā.
analyzed: gajjitā no vassitā vassitā no gajjitā gajjitā ca vassitā ca na iva gajjitā no vassitā
translated: those that thunder but do not rain, those that rain but do not thunder, those that both thunder and rain, and those that neither thunder nor rain.

original: Kathañca puggalo gajjitā hoti no vassitā?
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ gajjitā hoti no vassitā
translated: How is a person one who thunders but does not rain?

original: Idhekacco puggalo bhāsitā hoti, no kattā.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ bhāsitā hoti no kattā
translated: Here someone speaks but does not act.

original: Evaṁ puggalo gajjitā hoti, no vassitā.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ gajjitā hoti no vassitā
translated: That’s how a person thunders but doesn’t rain.

analyzed: seyyathā api saḥ valāhakaḥ gajjitā no vassitā tathūpamaḥ ayam puggalaḥ
translated: This person is like a cloud that thunders but doesn’t rain.

original: Kathañca puggalo vassitā hoti no gajjitā?
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ vassitā hoti no gajjitā
translated: And how does a person rain but not thunder?

analyzed: idha ekacco puggalo kattā hoti no bhāsitā  evam puggalaḥ vassitā hoti no gajjitā

analyzed: seyyathā api saḥ valāhakaḥ vassitā no gajjitā tathūpamaḥ ayam puggalaḥ
translated: This person is like a cloud that rains but doesn’t thunder.

original: Kathañca puggalo gajjitā ca hoti vassitā ca?
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ gajjitā ca hoti vassitā ca
translated: And how does a person both thunder and rain?

analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ bhāsitā ca hoti kattā ca  evam puggalaḥ gajjitā ca hoti vassitā ca

original: Seyyathāpi so valāhako gajjitā ca vassitā ca, tathūpamo ayaṁ puggalo.
analyzed: seyyathā api saḥ valāhakaḥ gajjitā ca vassitā ca tathūpamaḥ ayam puggalaḥ
translated: This person is like a cloud that both thunders and rains.

original: Kathañca puggalo neva gajjitā hoti no vassitā?🔽Idhekacco puggalo neva bhāsitā hoti no kattā.
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ na iva gajjitā hoti no vassitā  idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ na iva bhāsitā hoti no kattā
translated: And how does a person neither thunder nor rain?🔽It’s when a person is neither a speaker nor a doer.

original: Evaṁ puggalo neva gajjitā hoti no vassitā.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ na iva gajjitā hoti no vassitā
translated: That’s how a person neither thunders nor rains.

original: Seyyathāpi so valāhako neva gajjitā no vassitā, tathūpamo ayaṁ puggalo.
analyzed: seyyathā api saḥ valāhakaḥ na iva gajjitā no vassitā tathūpamaḥ ayam puggalaḥ
translated: This person is like the cloud that neither thunders nor rains.

analyzed: ime cattāro valāhaka upamā puggalā santaḥ sa vijjamānā lokasmi
translated: These are the four kinds of persons similar to clouds found in the world.

original: Tattha katame cattāro mūsikūpamā puggalā?
analyzed: tattha katame cattāraḥ mūsika upamā puggalā
translated: “And what, bhikkhus, are the four kinds of persons similar to mice?

analyzed: catassaḥ mūsikā
translated: There are four kinds of mice:

analyzed: gādham kattā naḥ vasitā vasitā naḥ gādham kattā gādham kattā ca vasitā ca na iva gādham kattā naḥ vasitā
translated: One digs a hole but does not live in it; another lives in it but does not dig a hole; another digs a hole and also lives in it; and another neither digs a hole nor lives in one.

analyzed: saḥ idam dukkhan ti yathābhūtam na ppajānāti ayam dukkha samudayaḥ iti yathābhūta  na ppajānāti ayam dukkha nirodho ti yathābhūtam na ppajānāti ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī

translated: He does not understand as it really is: ‘This is suffering. This is the origin of suffering. This is the cessation of suffering. This is the way leading to the cessation of suffering.’🔽This is how one is like a rat that digs a hole but does not live in it.

translated: They understand as it really is: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.🔽That’s how a person digs a hole and lives in it.

translated: And how is a person neither a bull elephant in his own assembly nor in the assembly of others?🔽There is the case where a certain person does not intimidate his own assembly or the assemblies of others.

original: Idhekacco puggalo neva sakaparisaṁ ubbejitā hoti no paraparisaṁ.🔽Evaṁ puggalo neva sakagavacaṇḍo hoti no paragavacaṇḍo.

translated: This is how a person is neither a bull elephant in his own assembly nor in the assembly of others.

translated: These are the four types of people comparable to oxen found in the world.

translated: This is how a person is one with poison only on the fangs, not in the body.

translated: And how does a person, after examination and reflection, speak in dispraise of one who is not worthy of praise and not speak in dispraise of one who is worthy of praise?

original: Idhekacco puggalo vaṇṇopi saṁvijjati avaṇṇopi saṁvijjati.🔽Yo tattha avaṇṇo taṁ bhaṇati bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena, yo tattha vaṇṇo taṁ na bhaṇati bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena.

translated: There is the case where a person has both good qualities & faults.🔽He speaks about the faults that are there, as they are, in specific detail. He speaks about the qualities that are there, as they are, in specific detail.

original: Evaṁ puggalo avaṇṇārahassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena, no ca kho vaṇṇārahassa vaṇṇaṁ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena.

translated: This is how a person speaks in line with what is right & true, but not in line with what is good & beneficial.

original: Kathañca puggalo vaṇṇārahassa vaṇṇaṁ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena, no ca kho avaṇṇārahassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena?

translated: “And how does a person speak in line with what is good & beneficial, but not in line with what is right & true?

original: Idhekacco puggalo vaṇṇopi saṁvijjati avaṇṇopi saṁvijjati.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ vaṇṇaḥ api savijjati a vaṇṇaḥ api savijjati
translated: There is the case where a person has both good qualities & faults.

original: Yo tattha vaṇṇo taṁ bhaṇati bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena, yo tattha avaṇṇo taṁ na bhaṇati bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena.
analyzed: yaḥ tattha vaṇṇo tam bhaṇati bhūtam taccham kālena yaḥ tattha avaṇṇo tam na bhaṇati bhūtam taccham kālena
translated: He speaks about the qualities that are there, as they are, in specific detail. He speaks about the faults that are there, as they are, in specific detail.

original: Evaṁ puggalo vaṇṇārahassa vaṇṇaṁ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena, no ca kho avaṇṇārahassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena.

translated: In this way, a person speaks in praise of those worthy of praise at the right time, with facts, with reasons, and with grounds, but does not speak in dispraise of those worthy of dispraise at the right time, with facts, with reasons, and with grounds.

original: Kathañca puggalo avaṇṇārahassa ca avaṇṇaṁ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena, vaṇṇārahassa ca vaṇṇaṁ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena?
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ avaṇṇā rahassa ca avaṇṇam bhāsitā hoti bhūtam taccham kālena vaṇṇā rahassa ca vaṇṇam bhāsitā hoti bhūtam taccham kālena
translated: And how does a person speak in dispraise of those worthy of dispraise at the right time, with facts, with reasons, and with grounds, and also speak in praise of those worthy of praise at the right time, with facts, with reasons, and with grounds?

original: Idhekacco puggalo vaṇṇopi saṁvijjati avaṇṇopi saṁvijjati.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ vaṇṇaḥ api savijjati a vaṇṇaḥ api savijjati
translated: There is the case where a person has both praise and dispraise.

original: Yo tattha avaṇṇo taṁ bhaṇati bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena, yopi tattha vaṇṇo tampi bhaṇati bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena.
analyzed: yaḥ tattha avaṇṇo tam bhaṇati bhūtam taccham kālena yaḥ api tattha vaṇṇo tam pi bhaṇati bhūtam taccham kālena
translated: He speaks of the dispraise there as it truly is, with facts, with reasons, and with grounds, and he speaks of the praise there as it truly is, with facts, with reasons, and with grounds.

original: Tatra kālaññū hoti tassa pañhassa veyyākaraṇāya.
analyzed: tatra kālaññū hoti tassa pañhassa veyyākaraṇāya
translated: He is timely in answering the question.

original: Evaṁ puggalo avaṇṇārahassa ca avaṇṇaṁ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena, vaṇṇārahassa ca vaṇṇaṁ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ avaṇṇā rahassa ca avaṇṇam bhāsitā hoti bhūtam taccham kālena vaṇṇā rahassa ca vaṇṇam bhāsitā hoti bhūtam taccham kālena
translated: In this way, a person speaks in dispraise of those worthy of dispraise at the right time, with facts, with reasons, and with grounds, and also speaks in praise of those worthy of praise at the right time, with facts, with reasons, and with grounds.

original: Kathañca puggalo neva avaṇṇārahassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena, nopi vaṇṇārahassa vaṇṇaṁ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena?
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ na iva avaṇṇā rahassa avaṇṇam bhāsitā hoti bhūtam taccham kālena na upi vaṇṇā rahassa vaṇṇam bhāsitā hoti bhūtam taccham kālena
translated: And how does a person not speak dispraise of those who deserve dispraise, speak truth, speak in a timely manner, and not speak praise of those who deserve praise, speak truth, speak in a timely manner?

original: Idhekacco puggalo vaṇṇopi saṁvijjati avaṇṇopi saṁvijjati.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ vaṇṇaḥ api savijjati a vaṇṇaḥ api savijjati
translated: Here, there is a person of whom it is said that there is dispraise and there is praise.

original: Yo tattha avaṇṇo taṁ na bhaṇati bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena, yopi tattha vaṇṇo tampi na bhaṇati bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena.
analyzed: yaḥ tattha avaṇṇo tam na bhaṇati bhūtam taccham kālena yaḥ api tattha vaṇṇo tam pi na bhaṇati bhūtam taccham kālena
translated: He does not speak the dispraise of him of whom it is said that there is dispraise, speak truth, speak in a timely manner, and he does not speak the praise of him of whom it is said that there is praise, speak truth, speak in a timely manner.

original: Upekkhako viharati sato sampajāno.
analyzed: upekkhakaḥ viharati sataḥ sampajāno
translated: He dwells equanimous, mindful, and fully aware.

original: Evaṁ puggalo neva avaṇṇārahassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena, nopi vaṇṇārahassa vaṇṇaṁ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ kālena.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ na iva avaṇṇā rahassa avaṇṇam bhāsitā hoti bhūtam taccham kālena na upi vaṇṇā rahassa vaṇṇam bhāsitā hoti bhūtam taccham kālena
translated: This is how a person does not speak dispraise of those who deserve dispraise, speak truth, speak in a timely manner, and not speak praise of those who deserve praise, speak truth, speak in a timely manner.

original: Katamo ca puggalo uṭṭhānaphalūpajīvī no puññaphalūpajīvī?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo uṭṭhāna phala upajīvī no puñña phala upajīvī
translated: And what kind of person makes a living by the fruits of his effort, not by the fruits of his merit?

original: Yassa puggalassa uṭṭhahato ghaṭato vāyamato ājīvo abhinibbattati, no puññato—
analyzed: yassa puggalassa uṭṭhahataḥ ghaṭataḥ vā āyamataḥ ājīvaḥ abhinibbattati no puññataḥ
translated: There is the case where a person’s livelihood comes from his effort, not from his merit.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “uṭṭhānaphalūpajīvī, no puññaphalūpajīvī”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ uṭṭhāna phala upajīvī no puñña phala upajīvī
translated: This is called a person who makes a living by the fruits of his effort, not by the fruits of his merit.

original: Katamo ca puggalo puññaphalūpajīvī no uṭṭhānaphalūpajīvī?
analyzed: katamo ca puggalo puñña phala upajīvī no uṭṭhāna phala upajīvī
translated: “Now, which is the person who makes use of the fruits of merit and not the fruits of activity?

original: Paranimmitavasavattī deve upādāya tatūpari devā puññaphalūpajīvino na uṭṭhānaphalūpajīvino.
analyzed: paranimmitavasavattī deve upādāya devā puñña phala upajīvinaḥ na uṭṭhāna phala upajīvinaḥ
translated: The gods of the Tavatimsa, Yama, Tusita, and Paranimmitavasavatti heavens make use of the fruits of merit and not the fruits of activity.

original: Katamo ca puggalo uṭṭhānaphalūpajīvī ca puññaphalūpajīvī ca?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo uṭṭhāna phala upajīvī ca puñña phala upajīvī ca
translated: “Now, which is the person who makes use of the fruits of activity and the fruits of merit?

original: Yassa puggalassa uṭṭhahato ghaṭato vāyamato ājīvo abhinibbattati puññato ca—
analyzed: yassa puggalassa uṭṭhahataḥ ghaṭataḥ vā āyamataḥ ājīvaḥ abhinibbattati puññataḥ ca
translated: The person whose livelihood arises from activity and from merit.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “uṭṭhānaphalūpajīvī ca puññaphalūpajīvī ca”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ uṭṭhāna phala upajīvī ca puñña phala upajīvī ca
translated: This is called the person who makes use of the fruits of activity and the fruits of merit.

original: Katamo ca puggalo neva uṭṭhānaphalūpajīvī no puññaphalūpajīvī?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo na iva uṭṭhāna phala upajīvī no puñña phala upajīvī
translated: “Now, which is the person who makes use of neither the fruits of activity nor the fruits of merit?

original: Nerayikā neva uṭṭhānaphalūpajīvino no puññaphalūpajīvino.
analyzed: nerayikāḥ na iva uṭṭhāna phala upajīvinaḥ no puñña phala upajīvinaḥ
translated: The beings in hell make use of neither the fruits of activity nor the fruits of merit.

original: Kathañca puggalo tamo hoti tamaparāyano?
analyzed: kathañca puggalo tamaḥ hoti tama parāyano
translated: “And how is one dark with a dark destiny?

original: Idhekacco puggalo nīce kule paccājāto hoti—
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ nīce kule paccājātaḥ hoti
translated: There is the case where a person is born into a low family—

original: caṇḍālakule vā nesādakule vā venakule vā rathakārakule vā pukkusakule vā dalidde appannapānabhojane kasiravuttike, yattha kasirena ghāsacchādo labbhati.
analyzed: caṇḍāla kule vā nesāda kule vā vena kule vā rathakāra kule vā pukkusa kule vā dalidde appanna pāna bhojane kasira vuttike yattha kasirena ghāsa chādaḥ labbhati
translated: in a family of outcasts, in a family of bamboo workers, in a family of hunters, in a family of cart makers, or in a family of scavengers—poor, with little to eat or drink, where it is hard to get by on alms.

original: So ca hoti dubbaṇṇo duddasiko okoṭimako bahvābādho kāṇo vā kuṇī vā khañjo vā pakkhahato
analyzed: so ca hoti dubbaṇṇaḥ duddasikaḥ okoṭimakaḥ bahu ābādhaḥ kāṇaḥ vā kuṇī vā khañjaḥ vā pakkha hato
translated: And he is ugly, unsightly, hunchbacked, dwarfish, crippled, lame, blind, or paralyzed.

original: vā, na lābhī annassa pānassa vatthassa yānassa mālāgandhavilepanassa seyyāvasathapadīpeyyassa.
analyzed: vā na lābhī annassa pānassa vatthassa yānassa mālā gandha vilepanassa seyyā āvasatha padīpeyyassa
translated: He does not get food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, scents, and unguents; bedding, housing, and lighting.

original: So kāyena duccaritaṁ carati, vācāya duccaritaṁ carati, manasā duccaritaṁ carati.
analyzed: saḥ kāyena duccaritam carati vācāya duccaritam carati manasā duccaritam carati
translated: He misconducts himself in body, speech, and mind.

original: So kāyena duccaritaṁ caritvā vācāya duccaritaṁ caritvā manasā duccaritaṁ caritvā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: saḥ kāyena duccaritam caritvā vācāya duccaritam caritvā manasā duccaritam caritvā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjati
translated: Having misconducted himself in body, speech, and mind, with the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in a lower realm, a bad destination, a state of misery, hell.

original: Evaṁ puggalo tamo hoti tamaparāyano.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ tamaḥ hoti tama parāyano
translated: This is how a person is dark and headed for darkness.

original: Kathañca puggalo tamo hoti jotiparāyano?
analyzed: kathañca puggalo tamaḥ hoti joti parāyano
translated: And how is a person dark and headed for light?

original: Idhekacco puggalo nīce kule paccājāto hoti—

original: caṇḍālakule vā nesādakule vā venakule vā rathakārakule vā pukkusakule vā dalidde appannapānabhojane kasiravuttike, yattha kasirena ghāsacchādo labbhati.

translated: in a family of outcasts, in a family of hunters, in a family of bamboo workers, in a family of chariot-makers, or in a family of refuse-scavengers, poor, with little to eat or drink, where it is hard to get by, and where food and drink are obtained with difficulty.

original: So ca hoti dubbaṇṇo duddasiko okoṭimako bahvābādho kāṇo vā kuṇī vā khañjo vā pakkhahato
analyzed: so ca hoti dubbaṇṇaḥ duddasikaḥ okoṭimakaḥ bahu ābādhaḥ kāṇaḥ vā kuṇī vā khañjaḥ vā pakkha hato
translated: And he is ugly, unsightly, hunchbacked, dwarfish, crippled, lame, blind, paralysed, or mute.

original: vā, na lābhī annassa pānassa vatthassa yānassa mālāgandhavilepanassa seyyāvasathapadīpeyyassa.🔽So kāyena sucaritaṁ carati, vācāya sucaritaṁ carati, manasā sucaritaṁ carati.

translated: He does not get food, drink, clothing, vehicles, garlands, scents, unguents, beds, lodging, or light.🔽But he conducts himself well in body, speech, and mind,

translated: and with the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world.

original: Evaṁ puggalo tamo hoti jotiparāyano.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ tamaḥ hoti joti parāyano
translated: This is how a person is dark with bright destination.

original: Kathañca puggalo joti hoti tamaparāyano?

translated: And how is a person bright with dark destination?

original: Idhekacco puggalo ucce kule paccājāto hoti—

original: khattiyamahāsālakule vā brāhmaṇamahāsālakule vā gahapatimahāsālakule vā aḍḍhe mahaddhane mahābhoge pahūtajātarūparajate pahūtavittūpakaraṇe pahūtadhanadhaññe.

translated: in a wealthy and prosperous khattiya family, or in a wealthy and prosperous brāhmaṇa family, or in a wealthy and prosperous gahapati family, one that is rich, with great wealth and property, with abundant gold and silver, with abundant treasures and commodities, with abundant wealth and grain.

original: So ca hoti abhirūpo dassanīyo pāsādiko paramāya vaṇṇapokkharatāya samannāgato, lābhī annassa pānassa vatthassa yānassa mālāgandhavilepanassa seyyāvasathapadīpeyyassa.

translated: And he is handsome, attractive, graceful, possessing supreme beauty of complexion, and he obtains food, drink, clothing, vehicles, garlands, scents and unguents, bed, lodging, and light.

original: So kāyena duccaritaṁ carati, vācāya duccaritaṁ carati, manasā duccaritaṁ carati.
analyzed: saḥ kāyena duccaritam carati vācāya duccaritam carati manasā duccaritam carati
translated: But he commits evil bodily, verbal, and mental actions.

original: So kāyena duccaritaṁ caritvā vācāya duccaritaṁ caritvā manasā duccaritaṁ caritvā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati.

translated: Having committed evil bodily, verbal, and mental actions, with the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in a state of misery, in a bad destination, in the nether world, in hell.

translated: And how is a person bright and heads for brightness?

translated: in a good family of aristocrats, brahmins, or householders—rich, with great wealth and property, with lots of gold and silver, with lots of property, money, grain, stores, and riches.

translated: Having practiced good bodily conduct, good verbal conduct, and good mental conduct, with the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world.

original: Evaṁ puggalo joti hoti jotiparāyano.

translated: This is how a person is radiant and heading towards radiance.

translated: This is how a person is both conceited and low.

analyzed: tattha katame cattāro rukkha upamā puggalā
translated: Herein, what are the four kinds of persons similar to trees?

original: Cattāro rukkhā—
analyzed: cattāro rukkhā
translated: There are four kinds of trees:

analyzed: pheggu sāra parivāraḥ sāraḥ pheggu parivāraḥ pheggu pheggu parivāraḥ sāraḥ sāra parivāraḥ

analyzed: evam evam cattāro me rukkha upamā puggalā santaḥ sa vijjamānā lokasmi
translated: So too, there are four kinds of persons similar to trees found in the world.

original: Katame cattāro?
analyzed: katame cattāro

translated: One who is soft and surrounded by soft trees, one who is soft and surrounded by hard trees, one who is hard and surrounded by soft trees, and one who is hard and surrounded by hard trees.

original: Kathañca puggalo pheggu hoti sāraparivāro?
analyzed: kathañca puggalo pheggu hoti sāra parivāro
translated: And how is a person soft and surrounded by soft trees?

original: Evaṁ puggalo pheggu hoti sāraparivāro.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ pheggu hoti sāra parivāraḥ
translated: This is how a person is soft and surrounded by soft trees.

original: Seyyathāpi so rukkho pheggu sāraparivāro, tathūpamo ayaṁ puggalo.
analyzed: seyyathā api saḥ rukkhaḥ pheggu sāra parivāraḥ tathūpamaḥ ayam puggalo
translated: Just as that tree is heartwood surrounded by sapwood, so too is this person.

original: Kathañca puggalo sāro hoti phegguparivāro?
analyzed: kathañca puggalo sāraḥ hoti pheggu parivāro
translated: “And how is a person heartwood surrounded by sapwood?

analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo sīlavā hoti kalyāṇa dhammo parisā ca khvassa hoti dussīlā pāpa dhammā

original: Evaṁ puggalo sāro hoti phegguparivāro.
analyzed: evam puggalo sāraḥ hoti pheggu parivāro
translated: Thus a person is heartwood surrounded by sapwood.

analyzed: seyyathā api saḥ rukkhaḥ sāraḥ pheggu parivāraḥ tathūpamaḥ ayam puggalo

original: Kathañca puggalo pheggu hoti phegguparivāro?
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ pheggu hoti pheggu parivāraḥ

original: Evaṁ puggalo pheggu hoti phegguparivāro.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ pheggu hoti pheggu parivāraḥ

translated: “And how is a person heartwood surrounded by heartwood?

analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo sīlavā hoti kalyāṇa dhammo parisā api ssa hoti sīlavatī kalyāṇa dhammā
translated: Here, a person is virtuous, of good character, and his followers are virtuous, of good character.

original: Evaṁ puggalo sāro hoti sāraparivāro.

translated: Thus a person is heartwood surrounded by heartwood.

translated: These are the four kinds of persons similar to trees found existing in the world.

original: Katamo ca puggalo rūpappamāṇo rūpappasanno?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ rūpa ppamāṇaḥ rūpa ppasanno
translated: “What kind of person is one who is confirmed in his confidence in the Dhamma?

original: Idhekacco puggalo ārohaṁ vā passitvā pariṇāhaṁ vā passitvā saṇṭhānaṁ vā passitvā pāripūriṁ vā passitvā tattha pamāṇaṁ gahetvā pasādaṁ janeti.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ āroham vā passitvā pariṇāham vā passitvā saṇṭhānam vā passitvā pāripūrim vā passitvā tattha pamāṇam gahetvā pasādam janeti
translated: Here some person, on seeing a visible form with the eye, having seized upon its marks and features, generates lust for the agreeable visible form and generates aversion for the disagreeable visible form.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati puggalo rūpappamāṇo rūpappasanno.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ rūpa ppamāṇaḥ rūpa ppasanno
translated: This is called a person who is confirmed in his confidence in the visible form.

original: Katamo ca puggalo ghosappamāṇo ghosappasanno?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ ghosa ppamāṇaḥ ghosa ppasanno
translated: “What kind of person is one who is confirmed in his confidence in the sound?

original: Idhekacco puggalo paravaṇṇanāya parathomanāya parapasaṁsanāya paravaṇṇahārikāya tattha pamāṇaṁ gahetvā pasādaṁ janeti.

translated: Here some person, on hearing a sound with the ear, having seized upon its marks and features, generates lust for the agreeable sound and generates aversion for the disagreeable sound.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati puggalo ghosappamāṇo ghosappasanno.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ ghosa ppamāṇaḥ ghosa ppasanno
translated: This is called a person who is confirmed in his confidence in the sound.

original: Katamo ca puggalo lūkhappamāṇo lūkhappasanno?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ lūkha pamāṇaḥ lūkha ppasanno
translated: “What kind of person is one who is confirmed in his confidence in the person?

original: Idhekacco puggalo cīvaralūkhaṁ vā passitvā pattalūkhaṁ vā passitvā senāsanalūkhaṁ vā passitvā vividhaṁ vā dukkarakārikaṁ passitvā tattha pamāṇaṁ gahetvā pasādaṁ janeti.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ cīvara lūkham vā passitvā patta lūkham vā passitvā senāsana lūkham vā passitvā vividham vā dukkara kārikam passitvā tattha pamāṇam gahetvā pasādam janeti
translated: Here someone, seeing the wearing of rough garments, the use of discarded rags for robes, or the various kinds of austerities, takes them as a standard and generates confidence in them.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati puggalo lūkhappamāṇo lūkhappasanno.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ lūkha ppamāṇaḥ lūkha ppasannaḥ
translated: This is called a person who is confident in a standard of roughness.

original: Katamo ca puggalo dhammappamāṇo dhammappasanno?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ dhamma ppamāṇaḥ dhamma ppasanno
translated: What is a person who is confident in a standard of the Dhamma?

original: Idhekacco puggalo sīlaṁ vā passitvā samādhiṁ vā passitvā paññaṁ vā passitvā tattha pamāṇaṁ gahetvā pasādaṁ janeti.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ sīlam vā passitvā samādhim vā passitvā paññam vā passitvā tattha pamāṇam gahetvā pasādam janeti
translated: Here someone, seeing virtue, concentration, or wisdom, takes them as a standard and generates confidence in them.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati puggalo dhammappamāṇo dhammappasanno.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ dhamma ppamāṇaḥ dhamma ppasanno
translated: This is called a person who is confident in a standard of the Dhamma.

original: Kathañca puggalo attahitāya paṭipanno hoti no parahitāya?
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ atta hitāya paṭipannaḥ hoti no para hitāya
translated: How is a person practicing for his own welfare but not for that of others?

original: Idhekacco puggalo attanā sīlasampanno hoti, no paraṁ sīlasampadāya samādapeti;🔽attanā samādhisampanno hoti, no paraṁ samādhisampadāya samādapeti;

translated: Here someone is accomplished in virtue himself but does not encourage others in accomplishing virtue;🔽he is accomplished in concentration himself but does not encourage others in accomplishing concentration;

original: attanā paññāsampanno hoti, no paraṁ paññāsampadāya samādapeti;
analyzed: attanā paññā sampannaḥ hoti no param paññā sampadāya samādapeti
translated: he is accomplished in wisdom himself but does not encourage others in accomplishing wisdom;

original: attanā vimuttisampanno hoti, no paraṁ vimuttisampadāya samādapeti;
analyzed: attanā vimutti sampannaḥ hoti no param vimutti sampadāya samādapeti
translated: he himself is perfected in deliverance, but he does not exhort others to perfect deliverance;

original: attanā vimuttiñāṇadassanasampanno hoti, no paraṁ vimuttiñāṇadassanasampadāya samādapeti.
analyzed: attanā vimutti ñāṇa dassana sampannaḥ hoti no param vimutti ñāṇa dassana sampadāya samādapeti
translated: he himself is perfected in knowledge and vision of deliverance, but he does not exhort others to perfect knowledge and vision of deliverance.

original: Evaṁ puggalo attahitāya paṭipanno hoti no parahitāya.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ atta hitāya paṭipannaḥ hoti no para hitāya
translated: This is how a person practices for his own welfare but not for the welfare of others.

original: Kathañca puggalo parahitāya paṭipanno hoti no attahitāya?
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ para hitāya paṭipannaḥ hoti no atta hitāya
translated: And how does a person practice for the welfare of others but not for his own welfare?

original: Idhekacco puggalo attanā na sīlasampanno hoti, paraṁ sīlasampadāya samādapeti;
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ attanā na sīla sampannaḥ hoti param sīla sampadāya samādapeti
translated: Here someone himself is not perfected in virtue, but he exhorts others to perfect virtue;

original: attanā na samādhisampanno hoti, paraṁ samādhisampadāya samādapeti;
analyzed: na samādhi sampannaḥ hoti param samādhi sampadāya samādapa iti
translated: he himself is not perfected in concentration, but he exhorts others to perfect concentration;

original: attanā na paññāsampanno hoti, paraṁ paññāsampadāya samādapeti;
analyzed: attanā na paññā sampannaḥ hoti param paññā sampadāya samādapeti
translated: he himself is not perfected in wisdom, but he exhorts others to perfect wisdom;

original: attanā na vimuttisampanno hoti, paraṁ vimuttisampadāya samādapeti;
analyzed: attanā na vimutti sampannaḥ hoti param vimutti sampadāya samādapeti
translated: he himself is not perfected in deliverance, but he exhorts others to perfect deliverance;

original: attanā na vimuttiñāṇadassanasampanno hoti, paraṁ vimuttiñāṇadassanasampadāya samādapeti.
analyzed: attanā na vimutti ñāṇa dassana sampannaḥ hoti param vimutti ñāṇa dassana sampadāya samādapeti
