translated: There is the case where a Tathāgata appears in the world, worthy & rightly self-awakened, consummate in clear knowing & conduct, well-gone, an expert with regard to the cosmos, teacher of beings, awakened, blessed.🔽He, in various ways, criticizes & censures being & the generation of being, while praising & extolling the stilling of being.

original: So dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
analyzed: saḥ dhammam deseti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjana kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāseti
translated: He teaches the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing, revealing a holy life that’s utterly perfect & pure.

original: Taṁ dhammaṁ suṇāti gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā aññatarasmiṁ vā kule paccājāto.
analyzed: tam dhammam suṇāti gahapati vā gahapati putto vā aññatarasmim vā kule paccājātaḥ
translated: A householder or householder’s son or one born in some other clan hears that Dhamma.

original: So taṁ dhammaṁ sutvā tathāgate saddhaṁ paṭilabhati.
analyzed: saḥ tam dhammam sutvā tathāgate saddham paṭilabhati
translated: On hearing the Dhamma, he acquires faith in the Tathāgata.

original: So tena saddhāpaṭilābhena samannāgato iti paṭisañcikkhati—
analyzed: saḥ tena saddhā paṭilābhena samannāgataḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: Endowed with that faith, he considers it this:

original: “sambādho gharāvāso rajāpatho, abbhokāso pabbajjā.
analyzed: sambādhaḥ gharāvāsaḥ rajāpathaḥ abbhokāsaḥ pabbajjā
translated: ‘Constrained is household life, a dusty path. It is not easy, living as a householder, to live the holy life utterly perfect & pure as a polished shell.

original: Nayidaṁ sukaraṁ agāraṁ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṁ ekantaparisuddhaṁ saṅkhalikhitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carituṁ.
analyzed: na idam sukaram agāram ajjhāvasatā ekanta paripuṇṇam ekanta parisuddham saṅkha likhitam brahmacariyam caritu
translated: It’s not easy to live the spiritual life in the home, limited and cramped, as though in a cave.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajeyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni a chādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajeyyanti
translated: Why don’t I shave off my hair and beard, put on the ocher robes, and go forth into homelessness?”

original: So aparena samayena appaṁ vā bhogakkhandhaṁ pahāya mahantaṁ vā bhogakkhandhaṁ pahāya🔽appaṁ vā ñātiparivaṭṭaṁ pahāya mahantaṁ vā ñātiparivaṭṭaṁ pahāya kesamassuṁ ohāretvā
analyzed: so aparena samayena appam vā bhogakkhandham pahāya mahantam vā bhogakkhandham pahāya  appam vā ñāti parivaṭṭam pahāya mahantam vā ñāti parivaṭṭam pahāya kesa massuṃ ohāretvā
translated: So after a time, having given up a large or small amount of wealth,

original: kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati.
analyzed: kāsāyāni vatthāni a chādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajati
translated: and having given up a large or small circle of relatives, he shaves off his hair and beard, puts on the ocher robes, and goes forth into homelessness.🔽Having gone forth, he trains in the higher virtue, the higher mind, and the higher wisdom.

original: So evaṁ pabbajito samāno bhikkhūnaṁ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati.
analyzed: saḥ evam pabbajitaḥ samānaḥ bhikkhūnam sikkhā sājīva samāpanno pāṇa atipātam pahāya pāṇa atipātā paṭivirataḥ hoti nihita daṇḍaḥ nihita satthaḥ lajjī dayā āpannaḥ sabba pāṇa bhūta hita anukampī viharati
translated: He gives up killing living creatures, renouncing the killing of living creatures. He abstains from killing living creatures, renouncing the killing of living creatures. He has conscience and shame, merciful and compassionate, living full of sympathy for all living beings.

original: Adinnādānaṁ pahāya adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti dinnādāyī dinnapāṭikaṅkhī, athenena sucibhūtena attanā viharati.
analyzed: a dinna ādānam pahāya a dinna ādānā paṭivirataḥ hoti dinna ādāyī dinna pāṭikaṅkhī atha enena sucibhūtena attanā viharati
translated: He gives up stealing and abstains from stealing. He takes only what’s given, and expects only what’s given. He lives purely, without taking what’s not given.

original: Abrahmacariyaṁ pahāya brahmacārī hoti ārācārī paṭivirato methunā gāmadhammā.🔽Musāvādaṁ pahāya musāvādā paṭivirato hoti saccavādī saccasandho theto paccayiko avisaṁvādako lokassa.
analyzed: a brahmacariyam pahāya brahmacārī hoti ārā cārī paṭivirataḥ methunāḥ gāma dhammāḥ  musāvādam pahāya musāvādā paṭivirataḥ hoti sacca vādī sacca sandho theto paccayikaḥ a visavādakaḥ lokassa
translated: He gives up unchastity and lives apart, celibate, secluded, abstaining from sexual intercourse.🔽He gives up lying and abstains from lying. He’s truthful, trustworthy, reliable, and doesn’t deceive the world.

original: Pisuṇaṁ vācaṁ pahāya pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, ito sutvā na amutra akkhātā imesaṁ bhedāya, amutra vā sutvā na imesaṁ akkhātā amūsaṁ bhedāya.
analyzed: pisuṇam vācam pahāya pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirataḥ hoti itas sutvā na amutra akkhātāḥ imesam bhedāya amutra vā sutvā na imesam akkhātāḥ amūsam bhedāya
translated: He gives up divisive speech and abstains from divisive speech. What he has heard here he doesn’t tell there to break those people apart from these people here. What he has heard there he doesn’t tell here to break these people apart from those people there.

original: Iti bhinnānaṁ vā sandhātā sahitānaṁ vā anuppadātā samaggārāmo samaggarato samagganandī samaggakaraṇiṁ vācaṁ bhāsitā hoti.
analyzed: iti bhinnānam vā sandhātā sahitānam vā anuppadātā samagga ārāmaḥ samagga rataḥ samagga nandī samagga karaṇim vācam bhāsitā hoti
translated: In this way he reconciles those who have broken apart, delights those who are joined together, and doesn’t take sides with any faction. He feels affection and has goodwill toward all factions, and he speaks accordingly.

original: Pharusaṁ vācaṁ pahāya pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti.
analyzed: pharusam vācam pahāya pharusāya vācāya paṭivirataḥ hoti
translated: He gives up harsh speech and abstains from harsh speech.

original: Yā sā vācā nelā kaṇṇasukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅgamā porī bahujanakantā bahujanamanāpā tathārūpiṁ vācaṁ bhāsitā hoti.
analyzed: yā sā vācā nelā kaṇṇa sukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅgamā porī bahu jana kantā bahu jana manāpā tathārūpim vācam bhāsitā hoti
translated: He speaks in a way that is smooth, pleasing to the ear, and lovable, that goes to the heart, is polite, desirable to many, and pleasing to many.

original: Samphappalāpaṁ pahāya samphappalāpā paṭivirato hoti, kālavādī bhūtavādī atthavādī dhammavādī vinayavādī nidhānavatiṁ vācaṁ bhāsitā kālena sāpadesaṁ pariyantavatiṁ atthasaṁhitaṁ.
analyzed: samphappalāpam pahāya samphappalāpā paṭivirataḥ hoti kāla vādī bhūta vādī attha vādī dhamma vādī vinaya vādī nidhānavatim vācam bhāsitā kālena sa apadesam pariyantavatim attha sahita
translated: He has given up idle chatter and abandons it. He speaks in season, speaks what is factual, what is in accordance with the goal, the Dhamma, and the Vinaya. He speaks words worth treasuring, timely, reasonable, and beneficial.

original: So bījagāmabhūtagāmasamārambhā paṭivirato hoti, ekabhattiko hoti rattūparato virato🔽vikālabhojanā, naccagītavāditavisūkadassanā paṭivirato hoti, mālāgandhavilepanadhāraṇamaṇḍanavibhūsanaṭṭhānā🔽paṭivirato hoti, uccāsayanamahāsayanā paṭivirato hoti, jātarūparajatapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti.
analyzed: saḥ bīja gāma bhūta gāma samārambhā paṭivirataḥ hoti ekabhattikaḥ hoti rattu uparataḥ virataḥ  vikāla bhojanā nacca gīta vādita visūka dassanā paṭivirataḥ hoti mālā gandha vilepana dhāraṇa maṇḍana vibhūsana ṭṭhānā  paṭivirataḥ hoti uccā sayana mahā sayanā paṭivirataḥ hoti jātarūpa rajata paṭiggahaṇā paṭivirataḥ hoti
translated: He has given up destroying seeds and plants and abandons it. He eats in one part of the day, refraining from food at night and from eating at the wrong time.🔽He has given up dancing, singing, instrumental music, and watching shows, and abandons it. He has given up wearing garlands, embellishing himself with scents, and beautifying himself with cosmetics, and abandons it.🔽He has given up high and luxurious beds and seats, and abandons them. He has given up accepting gold and silver, and abandons it.

original: Āmakadhaññapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti, āmakamaṁsapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti, itthikumārikāpaṭiggahaṇā
analyzed: āmaka dhañña paṭiggahaṇā paṭivirataḥ hoti āmaka masa paṭiggahaṇā paṭivirataḥ hoti itthi kumārikā paṭiggahaṇā
translated: He has given up accepting raw grain, and abandons it. He has given up accepting raw meat, and abandons it. He has given up accepting women and girls,

original: paṭivirato hoti, dāsidāsapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti, ajeḷakapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato
analyzed: paṭivirataḥ hoti dāsi dāsa paṭiggahaṇā paṭivirataḥ hoti ajeḷaka paṭiggahaṇā paṭivirataḥ
translated: he abstains from accepting elephants, cattle, horses, and mares;🔽from accepting male and female bondservants; from accepting goats and sheep;

original: hoti, kukkuṭasūkarapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti, hatthigavāssavaḷavapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato
analyzed: hoti kukkuṭa sūkara paṭiggahaṇā paṭivirataḥ hoti hatthi gavāssa vaḷava paṭiggahaṇā paṭivirataḥ
translated: from accepting chickens and pigs; from accepting fowl and deer;

original: hoti, khettavatthupaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti, dūteyyapahiṇagamanānuyogā paṭivirato🔽hoti, kayavikkayā paṭivirato hoti, tulākūṭakaṁsakūṭamānakūṭā paṭivirato hoti, ukkoṭanavañcananikatisāciyogā
analyzed: hoti khetta vatthu paṭiggahaṇā paṭivirataḥ hoti dūteyya pahiṇa gamana anuyogā paṭivirataḥ  hoti kaya vikkayā paṭivirataḥ hoti tulā kūṭaka sa kūṭa māna kūṭā paṭivirataḥ hoti ukkoṭana vañcana nikati sāci yogā
translated: from accepting fields and land. He abstains from running errands and from the buying and selling of goods;🔽from cheating with weights and measures; from cheating in business; from accepting women, men, boys, and girls;

original: paṭivirato hoti, chedanavadhabandhanaviparāmosaālopasahasākārā paṭivirato hoti.
analyzed: paṭivirataḥ hoti chedana vadha bandhana viparāmosa ālopa sahasākārā paṭivirataḥ hoti
translated: from accepting fields and land. He abstains from cheating by taking the first portion, from cheating with dice, from cheating with women, from cheating with monastic requisites, and from accepting gold, silver, and gems.

original: So santuṭṭho hoti kāyaparihārikena cīvarena kucchiparihārikena piṇḍapātena.
analyzed: so santuṭṭhaḥ hoti kāya parihārikena cīvarena kucchi parihārikena piṇḍapātena
translated: He is content with robes to look after the body and almsfood to look after the belly.🔽Wherever he goes, he sets out taking only these things,

original: So yena yeneva pakkamati samādāyeva pakkamati, seyyathāpi nāma pakkhī sakuṇo yena yeneva ḍeti sapattabhārova ḍeti.
analyzed: saḥ yena yena iva pakkamati samādāya iva pakkamati seyyathā api nāma pakkhī sakuṇaḥ yena yena iva ḍeti sa patta bhāraḥ uva ḍeti
translated: just as a bird, wherever it flies, flies taking only its wings.

original: Evamevaṁ bhikkhu santuṭṭho hoti kāyaparihārikena cīvarena kucchiparihārikena piṇḍapātena.
analyzed: evam evam bhikkhu santuṭṭhaḥ hoti kāya parihārikena cīvarena kucchi parihārikena piṇḍapātena
translated: In the same way, a monk is content with robes to protect his body and almsfood to sustain his belly.

original: So yena yeneva pakkamati samādāyeva pakkamati.
analyzed: saḥ yena yena iva pakkamati samādāya iva pakkamati
translated: Wherever he goes, he sets out taking only these things.

original: So iminā ariyena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato ajjhattaṁ anavajjasukhaṁ paṭisaṁvedeti.
analyzed: saḥ iminā ariyena sīla kkhandhena samannāgataḥ ajjhattam anavajja sukham paṭisavedeti
translated: Endowed with this aggregate of noble virtue, he experiences a blameless happiness within.

original: So cakkhunā rūpaṁ disvā na nimittaggāhī hoti nānubyañjanaggāhī.🔽Yatvādhikaraṇamenaṁ cakkhundriyaṁ asaṁvutaṁ viharantaṁ abhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā
analyzed: so cakkhunā rūpam disvā na nimitta ggāhī hoti na anubyañjana ggāhī  yatvā adhikaraṇam enam cakkhu indriyam asavutam viharantam abhijjhā domanassā pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ
translated: On seeing a form with the eye, he does not grasp at its signs and features.

original: dhammā anvāssaveyyuṁ, tassa saṁvarāya paṭipajjati, rakkhati cakkhundriyaṁ, cakkhundriye saṁvaraṁ āpajjati;
analyzed: dhammāḥ anvāssaveyyu tassa savarāya paṭipajjati rakkhati cakkhu indriya cakkhu indriye savaram āpajjati
translated: Since, if he left the eye faculty unguarded, bad, unwholesome states of longing and dejection might invade him, he practices the way of its restraint, he guards the eye faculty, he undertakes the restraint of the eye faculty.

original: sotena saddaṁ sutvā …pe…🔽ghānena gandhaṁ ghāyitvā …pe…
analyzed: sotena saddam sutvā pe  ghānena gandham ghāyitvā pe
translated: On hearing a sound with the ear…🔽On smelling an odor with the nose…

original: jivhāya rasaṁ sāyitvā …pe…
analyzed: jivhāya rasam sāyitvā pe
translated: On tasting a flavor with the tongue…

original: kāyena phoṭṭhabbaṁ phusitvā …pe…
analyzed: kāyena phoṭṭhabbam phusitvā pe
translated: On touching a tactile object with the body…

original: manasā dhammaṁ viññāya na nimittaggāhī hoti nānubyañjanaggāhī.
analyzed: manasā dhammam viññāya na nimitta ggāhī hoti na anubyañjana ggāhī
translated: On cognizing an idea with the intellect, he does not grasp at its signs and features.

original: Yatvādhikaraṇamenaṁ manindriyaṁ asaṁvutaṁ viharantaṁ abhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā
analyzed: yatvā adhikaraṇam enam man indriyam viharantam abhijjhā domanassā pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ
translated: If the mind faculty is unguarded, evil unwholesome states of covetousness and grief might invade him,

original: dhammā anvāssaveyyuṁ, tassa saṁvarāya paṭipajjati, rakkhati manindriyaṁ, manindriye saṁvaraṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: dhammāḥ anvāssaveyyu tassa savarāya paṭipajjati rakkhati manindriya manindriye savaram āpajjati
translated: so he practises guarding for the mind faculty, he protects the mind faculty, and maintains a guarded mind faculty.

original: So iminā ariyena indriyasaṁvarena samannāgato ajjhattaṁ abyāsekasukhaṁ paṭisaṁvedeti.
analyzed: saḥ iminā ariyena indriya savarena samannāgataḥ ajjhattam a byāseka sukham paṭisaveda iti
translated: Endowed with this noble restraint of the faculties, he experiences within himself a bliss that is blameless.🔽He is one who acts with clear comprehension when going forward and returning;

original: So abhikkante paṭikkante sampajānakārī hoti, ālokite vilokite sampajānakārī hoti,🔽samiñjite pasārite sampajānakārī hoti, saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇe sampajānakārī hoti,
analyzed: saḥ abhikkante paṭikkante sampajāna kārī hoti ālokite vilokite sampajāna kārī hoti  samiñjite pasārite sampajānakārī hoti saṅghāṭi patta cīvara dhāraṇe sampajānakārī hoti
translated: who acts with clear comprehension when looking ahead and looking aside;🔽who acts with clear comprehension when drawing in and extending the limbs; who acts with clear comprehension when wearing the robes and carrying the alms bowl;

original: asite pīte khāyite sāyite sampajānakārī hoti, uccārapassāvakamme sampajānakārī hoti,
analyzed: asite pīte khāyite sāyite sampajāna kārī hoti uccāra passāva kamme sampajāna kārī hoti
translated: who acts with clear comprehension when eating, drinking, consuming food, and tasting; who acts with clear comprehension when defecating and urinating;

original: gate ṭhite nisinne sutte jāgarite bhāsite tuṇhībhāve sampajānakārī hoti.
analyzed: gate ṭhite nisinne sutte jāgarite bhāsite tuṇhībhāve sampajāna kārī hoti
translated: who acts with clear comprehension when walking, standing, sitting, falling asleep, waking up, talking, and keeping silent.

original: So iminā ca ariyena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato iminā ca ariyena indriyasaṁvarena
analyzed: saḥ iminā ca ariyena sīla kkhandhena samannāgataḥ iminā ca ariyena indriya savarena
translated: Endowed with this noble aggregate of moral discipline and

original: samannāgato iminā ca ariyena satisampajaññena samannāgato imāya ca ariyāya santuṭṭhiyā
analyzed: samannāgataḥ iminā ca ariyena sati sampajaññena samannāgataḥ imāya ca ariyāya santuṭṭhiyā
translated: and with this noble contentment,

original: samannāgato vivittaṁ senāsanaṁ bhajati araññaṁ rukkhamūlaṁ pabbataṁ kandaraṁ giriguhaṁ
analyzed: samannāgataḥ vivittam senāsanam bhajati araññam rukkha mūlam pabbatam kandaram giri guha
translated: he frequents a solitary lodging, a forest, the foot of a tree, a mountain, a ravine, a hillside cave,

original: susānaṁ vanapatthaṁ abbhokāsaṁ palālapuñjaṁ.
analyzed: su sānam vana pattham abbhokāsam palāla puñja
translated: a charnel ground, a jungle thicket, an open space, a heap of straw.

original: So pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto nisīdati pallaṅkaṁ ābhujitvā ujuṁ kāyaṁ paṇidhāya parimukhaṁ satiṁ upaṭṭhapetvā.
analyzed: saḥ pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkantaḥ nisīdati pallaṅkam ābhujitvā ujum kāyam paṇidhāya parimukham satim upaṭṭhapetvā
translated: After returning from his alms round, after his meal he sits down, folding his legs crosswise, setting his body erect, and establishing mindfulness in front of him.

original: So abhijjhaṁ loke pahāya vigatābhijjhena cetasā viharati, abhijjhāya cittaṁ parisodheti;
analyzed: saḥ abhijjham loke pahāya vigata abhijjhena cetasā viharati abhijjhāya cittam parisodheti
translated: He, abandoning hankering for the world, dwells with a mind free from hankering; he purifies his mind from hankering.

original: byāpādapadosaṁ pahāya abyāpannacitto viharati sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī, byāpādapadosā cittaṁ parisodheti;
analyzed: byāpāda padosam pahāya a byāpanna cittaḥ viharati sabba pāṇa bhūta hita anukampī byāpāda padosā cittam parisodheti
translated: Abandoning ill will and hatred, he dwells with a mind free of ill will, compassionate for the welfare of all living beings; he purifies his mind from ill will.

original: thinamiddhaṁ pahāya vigatathinamiddho viharati ālokasaññī sato sampajāno, thinamiddhā cittaṁ parisodheti;
analyzed: thinamiddham pahāya vigata thinamiddhaḥ viharati āloka saññī sataḥ sampajānaḥ thinamiddhā cittam parisodheti
translated: Abandoning sloth and torpor, he dwells free from sloth and torpor, percipient of light, mindful and fully aware; he purifies his mind from sloth and torpor.

original: uddhaccakukkuccaṁ pahāya anuddhato viharati ajjhattaṁ vūpasantacitto, uddhaccakukkuccā cittaṁ parisodheti;
analyzed: uddhacca kukkuccam pahāya anuddhataḥ viharati ajjhattam vūpasanta cittaḥ uddhacca kukkuccā cittam parisodheti
translated: He dwells without agitation, his mind inwardly peaceful, and he purifies his mind of agitation.

original: vicikicchaṁ pahāya tiṇṇavicikiccho viharati akathaṅkathī kusalesu dhammesu, vicikicchāya cittaṁ parisodheti.
analyzed: vicikiccham pahāya tiṇṇa vicikicchaḥ viharati a kathaṅkathī kusalesu dhammesu vicikicchāya cittam parisodheti
translated: He dwells without doubt, having gone beyond doubt about wholesome qualities, and he purifies his mind of doubt.🔽Having abandoned these five hindrances, defilements of the mind that weaken wisdom,

original: So ime pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe vivicceva kāmehi🔽vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṁ savicāraṁ vivekajaṁ pītisukhaṁ paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ
analyzed: saḥ ime pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetasaḥ upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe vivicca iva kāmehi  vivicca akusalehi dhammehi sa vitakkam sa vicāram viveka jam pīti sukham paṭhamam jhāna
translated: quite secluded from sensual pleasures,

original: upasampajja viharati;🔽vitakkavicārānaṁ vūpasamā ajjhattaṁ sampasādanaṁ cetaso ekodibhāvaṁ avitakkaṁ avicāraṁ samādhijaṁ pītisukhaṁ dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati;
analyzed: upasampajja viharati  vitakka vicārānam vūpasamāḥ ajjhattam sampasādanam cetasaḥ eka udi bhāvam a vitakkam a vicāram samādhi jam pīti sukham dutiyam jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: he enters and dwells in the first jhāna, which consists of rapture and pleasure born of seclusion, accompanied by thought and examination.🔽With the subsiding of thought and examination, he enters and dwells in the second jhāna, which has internal placidity and unification of mind and consists of rapture and pleasure born of concentration, without thought and examination.

original: pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati sato ca sampajāno sukhañca kāyena paṭisaṁvedeti,
analyzed: pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati sataḥ ca sampajāno sukham ca kāyena paṭisavedeti
translated: With the fading away as well of rapture, he dwells equanimous and, mindful and clearly comprehending, he experiences pleasure with the body; he enters and dwells in the third jhāna of which the noble ones declare: ‘He is equanimous, mindful, one who dwells happily.’

original: yaṁ taṁ ariyā ācikkhanti—“upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī”ti tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati;
analyzed: yam tam ariyāḥ ācikkhanti upekkhakaḥ satimā sukha vihārī iti tatiyam jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: born of concentration the west, the north, the south,🔽the directions below and above, and everywhere in between.🔽He sits pervading the all-encompassing world with a mind filled with loving-kindness, vast, exalted, measureless, without hostility, without ill will.

original: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbeva somanassadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamā adukkhamasukhaṁ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṁ catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbā iva somanassa domanassānam atthaṅgamā adukkham asukham upekkhā sati pārisuddhim catuttham jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: He sits pervading the all-encompassing world with a mind filled with compassion … with a mind filled with sympathetic joy … with a mind filled with equanimity, vast, exalted, measureless, without hostility, without ill will.🔽When his concentrated mind is purified, bright, unblemished, rid of imperfection, malleable, wieldy, steady, and attained to imperturbability, he directs it to knowledge of the recollection of past lives.

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmeti.🔽So anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati, seyyathidaṁ—🔽ekampi jātiṁ dvepi jātiyo tissopi jātiyo catassopi jātiyo pañcapi jātiyo dasapi jātiyo
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmeti  so aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarati  ekam pi jātim dve pi jātiyaḥ tisso api jātiyaḥ catasso pi jātiyaḥ pañca api jātiyaḥ dasa api jātiyaḥ
translated: He recollects his manifold past lives, i.e.🔽one birth, two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty,

original: vīsampi jātiyo tiṁsampi jātiyo cattālīsampi jātiyo paññāsampi jātiyo jātisatampi
analyzed: vīsampi jātiyo tisampi jātiyo cattālīsampi jātiyo paññāsampi jātiyaḥ jāti satampi
translated: a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand, many eons of cosmic contraction, many eons of cosmic expansion, many eons of cosmic contraction and expansion,

original: jātisahassampi jātisatasahassampi anekepi saṁvaṭṭakappe anekepi vivaṭṭakappe anekepi
analyzed: jāti sahassam pi jāti sata sahassam pi aneke pi savaṭṭa kappe aneke pi vivaṭṭa kappe aneke pi
translated: a thousand aeons, a hundred thousand aeons, or even more than that,

original: saṁvaṭṭavivaṭṭakappe—
analyzed: sa vaṭṭa vivaṭṭa kappe
translated: many aeons of world-dissolution, many aeons of world-evolution, many aeons of both world-dissolution and world-evolution:

original: “amutrāsiṁ evaṁnāmo evaṅgotto evaṁvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṁsukhadukkhapaṭisaṁvedī evamāyupariyanto, so tato cuto amutra udapādiṁ;
analyzed: amutra asim eva nāmaḥ evaṃgotto eva vaṇṇo evam āhāro eva sukha dukkha paṭisavedī evam āyu pariyanto saḥ tatas cutaḥ amutra udapādi
translated: ‘There I was with such a name, belonging to such a clan, with such an appearance, such food, such experience of pleasure and pain, such a life-term;

original: tatrāpāsiṁ evaṁnāmo evaṅgotto evaṁvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṁsukhadukkhapaṭisaṁvedī evamāyupariyanto, so tato cuto idhūpapanno”ti.
analyzed: tatra apāsim eva nāmaḥ evaṃgotto eva vaṇṇo evam āhāro eva sukha dukkha paṭisavedī evam āyu pariyanto saḥ tatas cutaḥ idhu upapanno ti
translated: and passing away from there, I re-arose elsewhere; and there too I was with such a name, belonging to such a clan, with such an appearance, such food, such experience of pleasure and pain, such a life-term; and passing away from there, I re-arose here.’

original: Iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati.
analyzed: iti sa ākāram sa uddesam aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarati
translated: Thus with its aspects and particulars he recollects his manifold past lives.

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte sattānaṁ cutūpapātañāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmeti.
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte sattānam cutūpapāta ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmeti
translated: “When his concentrated mind is thus purified, bright, unblemished, rid of imperfection, malleable, wieldy, steady, and attained to imperturbability, he directs it to knowledge of the passing away and reappearance of beings.

original: So dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāti—
analyzed: so dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathā kammūpage satte pajānāti
translated: With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, he sees beings passing away and arising: base and noble, well favored and ill favored, to happy and unhappy destinations as kamma directs them. He understands how beings pass on according to their kamma, like this:

original: “ime vata bhonto sattā kāyaduccaritena samannāgatā, vacīduccaritena samannāgatā, manoduccaritena samannāgatā, ariyānaṁ upavādakā, micchādiṭṭhikā micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā.🔽Te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapannā.🔽Ime vā pana bhonto sattā kāyasucaritena samannāgatā vacīsucaritena samannāgatā manosucaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṁ anupavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhikammasamādānā.
analyzed: ime vata bhonto sattā kāya duccaritena samannāgatāḥ vacī duccaritena samannāgatāḥ manaḥ duccaritena samannāgatāḥ ariyānam upavādakāḥ micchādiṭṭhikāḥ micchādiṭṭhi kamma samādānāḥ  te kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapannā  ime vā pana bhonto sattā kāya su caritena samannāgatāḥ vacī su caritena samannāgatāḥ manaḥ su caritena samannāgatāḥ ariyānam an upavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhi kamma samādānā
translated: “These worthy beings who were ill conducted in body, speech, and mind, revilers of noble ones, wrong in their views, giving effect to wrong view in their actions, on the dissolution of the body, after death, have reappeared in a state of deprivation, in a bad destination, in perdition, even in hell.

original: Te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapannā”ti.
analyzed: te kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapannā ati
translated: But these worthy beings who were well conducted in body, speech, and mind, not revilers of noble ones, right in their views, giving effect to right view in their actions, on the dissolution of the body, after death, have reappeared in a good destination, even in the heavenly world.”🔽Thus with the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, he sees beings passing away and arising: base and noble, well favored and ill favored, to happy and unhappy destinations as kamma directs them, and he understands how beings pass on according to their kamma.

original: So iti dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāti.🔽So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte āsavānaṁ khayañāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmeti.🔽So “idaṁ dukkhan”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, “ayaṁ dukkhasamudayo”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti,
analyzed: so iti dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathā kammūpage satte pajānāti  saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte āsavānam khaya ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmeti  saḥ idam dukkhan ti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha samudayaḥ iti yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: He understands how beings pass on according to their kamma.🔽“This is the noble truth of stress” … “This noble truth of stress is to be comprehended” … “This noble truth of stress has been comprehended” …

original: “ayaṁ dukkhanirodho”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, “ayaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā”ti🔽yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti,
analyzed: ayam dukkha nirodho ti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati  yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: “This is the noble truth of the origination of stress” … “This noble truth of the origination of stress is to be abandoned” … “This noble truth of the origination of stress has been abandoned” …

original: “ime āsavā”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, “ayaṁ āsavasamudayo”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti,
analyzed: ime āsavāḥ ti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam āsava samudayaḥ iti yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: “This is the noble truth of the cessation of stress” … “This noble truth of the cessation of stress is to be verified” … “This noble truth of the cessation of stress has been verified” …🔽“This is the noble truth of the path of practice leading to the cessation of stress” … “This noble truth of the path of practice leading to the cessation of stress is to be developed” … “This noble truth of the path of practice leading to the cessation of stress has been developed” …🔽“These are the effluents” … “This is the origination of the effluents” …

original: “ayaṁ āsavanirodho”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, “ayaṁ āsavanirodhagāminī paṭipadā”ti🔽yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti.
analyzed: ayam āsava nirodha uti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam āsava nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati 🔽yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: “This is the cessation of the effluents” … “This is the path of practice leading to the cessation of the effluents” …

original: Tassa evaṁ jānato evaṁ passato kāmāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccati, bhavāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccati, avijjāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccati.
analyzed: tassa evam jānataḥ evam passataḥ kāma āsavā api cittam vimuccati bhava āsavā api cittam vimuccati avijjā āsavā api cittam vimuccati
translated: When he knows and sees thus, his mind is liberated from the taint of sensual desire, from the taint of being, and from the taint of ignorance.

original: Vimuttasmiṁ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṁ hoti.
analyzed: vimuttasmin vimuttam iti ñāṇam hoti
translated: When it is liberated there comes the knowledge: ‘It is liberated.’

original: “Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā”ti pajānāti.
analyzed: brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati pajānāti
translated: He understands: ‘Birth is destroyed, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.’

original: Evaṁ puggalo neva attantapo ca hoti na attaparitāpanānuyogamanuyutto, na parantapo na paraparitāpanānuyogamanuyutto.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ na iva attantapaḥ ca hoti na atta paritāpana anuyogam anuyuttaḥ na parantapaḥ na para paritāpana anuyogam anuyuttaḥ
translated: This is the kind of person who does not torment himself or pursue the practice of torturing himself and who does not torment others or pursue the practice of torturing others.

original: So anattantapo aparantapo diṭṭheva dhamme nicchāto nibbuto sītībhūto sukhappaṭisaṁvedī brahmabhūtena attanā viharati.
analyzed: so anattantapaḥ aparantapaḥ diṭṭhe iva dhamme nicchātaḥ nibbutaḥ sītībhūto sukha ppaṭisavedī brahma bhūtena attanā viharati
translated: Not tormenting himself or pursuing the practice of torturing himself, not tormenting others or pursuing the practice of torturing others, he dwells in the here and now free of hunger, unbound, cooled, sensitive to pleasure, with a Brahmā-like mind.

original: Katamo ca puggalo sarāgo?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ sa rāgaḥ
translated: What kind of person is full of lust?

original: Yassa puggalassa rāgo appahīno, ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “sarāgo”.
analyzed: yassa puggalassa rāgaḥ a pahīnaḥ ayam vuccati puggalaḥ sa rāgaḥ
translated: The person in whom lust is unabandoned is called “full of lust.”

original: Katamo ca puggalo sadoso?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo sa dosaḥ
translated: What kind of person is full of hate?

original: Yassa puggalassa doso appahīno, ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “sadoso”.
analyzed: yassa puggalassa doso appahīnaḥ ayam vuccati puggalaḥ sa doso
translated: The person in whom hate is unabandoned is called “full of hate.”

original: Katamo ca puggalo samoho?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ sa mohaḥ
translated: What kind of person is full of delusion?

original: Yassa puggalassa moho appahīno, ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “samoho”.
analyzed: yassa puggalassa mohaḥ appahīnaḥ ayam vuccati puggalo sa moho
translated: He is called a person who is deluded.

original: Katamo ca puggalo samāno?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ samānaḥ
translated: “And what is a person who is conceited?

original: Yassa puggalassa māno appahīno, ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “samāno”.
analyzed: yassa puggalassa mānaḥ a pahīnaḥ ayam vuccati puggalo samānaḥ
translated: He is called a person who is conceited.

original: Kathañca puggalo lābhī hoti ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa, na lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya?
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ lābhī hoti ajjhattam cetaḥ samathassa na lābhī adhi paññā dhamma vipassanāya
translated: “And how is a person one who gains internal serenity of mind but not the higher wisdom of insight into phenomena?

original: Idhekacco puggalo lābhī hoti rūpasahagatānaṁ vā arūpasahagatānaṁ vā samāpattīnaṁ, na lābhī lokuttaramaggassa vā phalassa vā.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ lābhī hoti rūpa sahagatānam vā arūpa sahagatānam vā samāpattīna na lābhī lokuttara maggassa vā phalassa vā
translated: Here, someone gains the attainments with their accompanying pleasant feeling but does not gain the supramundane path and fruit.

original: Evaṁ puggalo lābhī hoti ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa, na lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ lābhī hoti ajjhattam cetaḥ samathassa na lābhī adhi paññā dhamma vipassanāya
translated: This is how a person gains internal serenity of mind but not the higher wisdom of insight into phenomena.

original: Kathañca puggalo lābhī hoti adhipaññādhammavipassanāya, na lābhī ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa?
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ lābhī hoti adhipaññā dhamma vipassanāya na lābhī ajjhattam cetaḥ samathassa
translated: “And how is a person one who gains the higher wisdom of insight into phenomena but not internal serenity of mind?

original: Idhekacco puggalo lābhī hoti lokuttaramaggassa vā phalassa vā, na lābhī rūpasahagatānaṁ vā arūpasahagatānaṁ vā samāpattīnaṁ.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ lābhī hoti lokuttara maggassa vā phalassa vā na lābhī rūpa sahagatānam vā arūpa sahagatānam vā samāpattīnaṃ
translated: Here, someone gains the supramundane path and fruit but does not gain the attainments with their accompanying pleasant feeling.

original: Evaṁ puggalo lābhī hoti adhipaññādhammavipassanāya, na lābhī ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ lābhī hoti adhipaññā dhamma vipassanāya na lābhī ajjhattam cetaḥ samathassa
translated: This is how a person gains knowledge of the Dhamma in the higher sense but does not gain mental unification.

original: Kathañca puggalo lābhī ceva hoti ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa, lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāya?
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ lābhī ca iva hoti ajjhattam cetaḥ samathassa lābhī ca adhi paññā dhamma vipassanāya
translated: How does a person gain both mental unification and knowledge of the Dhamma in the higher sense?

original: Idhekacco puggalo lābhī hoti rūpasahagatānaṁ vā arūpasahagatānaṁ vā samāpattīnaṁ, lābhī lokuttaramaggassa vā phalassa vā.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ lābhī hoti rūpa sahagatānam vā arūpa sahagatānam vā samāpattīna lābhī lokuttara maggassa vā phalassa vā
translated: Here a person gains the attainments with form and without form, or he gains the supramundane path or fruit.

original: Evaṁ puggalo lābhī ceva hoti ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa, lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ lābhī ca iva hoti ajjhattam cetaḥ samathassa lābhī ca adhi paññā dhamma vipassanāya
translated: This is how a person gains both mental unification and knowledge of the Dhamma in the higher sense.

original: Kathañca puggalo neva lābhī hoti ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa, na lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya?
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ na iva lābhī hoti ajjhattam cetaḥ samathassa na lābhī adhi paññā dhamma vipassanāya
translated: How does a person gain neither mental unification nor knowledge of the Dhamma in the higher sense?

original: Idhekacco puggalo neva lābhī hoti rūpasahagatānaṁ vā arūpasahagatānaṁ vā samāpattīnaṁ, na lābhī lokuttaramaggassa vā phalassa vā.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ na iva lābhī hoti rūpa sahagatānam vā arūpa sahagatānam vā samāpattīna na lābhī lokuttara maggassa vā phalassa vā
translated: Here a person gains neither the attainments with form and without form, nor the supramundane path or fruit.

original: Evaṁ puggalo neva lābhī hoti ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa, na lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ na iva lābhī hoti ajjhattam cetaḥ samathassa na lābhī adhi paññā dhamma vipassanāya
translated: This is how a person does not gain inner tranquility of awareness or the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

original: Katamo ca puggalo anusotagāmī?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ anusota gāmī
translated: “And what kind of person is one who goes with the stream?

original: Idhekacco puggalo kāme ca paṭisevati pāpañca kammaṁ karoti.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo kāme ca paṭisevati pāpam ca kammam karoti
translated: There is the case where a person enjoys sensual pleasures and performs actions born of sensual pleasure.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “anusotagāmī”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ anusota gāmī
translated: This is called a person who goes with the stream.

original: Katamo ca puggalo paṭisotagāmī?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo paṭisota gāmī
translated: “And what kind of person is one who goes against the stream?

original: Idhekacco puggalo kāme ca na paṭisevati pāpañca kammaṁ na karoti.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ kāme ca na paṭisevati pāpam ca kammam na karoti
translated: There is the case where a person does not enjoy sensual pleasures and does not perform actions born of sensual pleasure.

original: So sahāpi dukkhena sahāpi domanassena assumukhenapi rudamāno paripuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carati.
analyzed: saḥ saha api dukkhena saha api domanassena assu mukhena api rudamānaḥ paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam carati
translated: He practices the practice of the skillful for the going out of unskillful thoughts that have arisen, for the stilling of unskillful thoughts that have arisen.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “paṭisotagāmī”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo paṭisota gāmī
translated: This is called a person who goes against the stream.

original: Katamo ca puggalo ṭhitatto?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo ṭhita tto
translated: “And what kind of person is one who is steadied?

original: Idhekacco puggalo pañcannaṁ orambhāgiyānaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo pañcannam orambhāgiyānam sayojanānam parikkhayā opapātikaḥ hoti tattha parinibbāyī an āvatti dhammo tasmā lokā
translated: There is the case where a person, with the ending of the effluents, enters & remains in the effluent-free awareness-release & discernment-release, directly knowing & realizing it for himself right in the here-&-now.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “ṭhitatto”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo ṭhita ttaḥ
translated: This is called a person who is steadied.

original: Katamo ca puggalo tiṇṇo pāraṅgato thale tiṭṭhati brāhmaṇo?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo tiṇṇaḥ pāraṅgataḥ thale tiṭṭhati brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: “And what kind of person has crossed over and gone beyond to the far shore, standing on high ground, a brahmin?

original: Idhekacco puggalo āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati
translated: There is the case where a person, through the ending of effluents, dwells in the awareness-release & discernment-release that are free from effluents, having directly known & realized them for himself right in the here-&-now.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati puggalo tiṇṇo pāraṅgato thale tiṭṭhati brāhmaṇo.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo tiṇṇaḥ pāraṅgataḥ thale tiṭṭhati brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: This is called a person who has crossed over and gone beyond to the far shore, standing on high ground, a brahmin.

original: Kathañca puggalo appassuto hoti sutena anupapanno?
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ appassutaḥ hoti sutena anupapannaḥ
translated: “And how is a person unlearned, not in accordance with what he has learned?

original: Idhekaccassa puggalassa appakaṁ sutaṁ hoti suttaṁ geyyaṁ veyyākaraṇaṁ gāthaṁ udānaṁ itivuttakaṁ jātakaṁ abbhutadhammaṁ vedallaṁ.
analyzed: idha ekaccassa puggalassa appakam sutam hoti suttam geyyam veyyākaraṇam gātham udānam itivuttakam jātakam abbhuta dhammam vedalla
translated: There is the case where a person has learned little Dhamma—a verse or two, a triad or a couplet.

original: So tassa appakassa sutassa na atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammappaṭipanno hoti.
analyzed: so tassa appakassa sutassa na attha maññāya dhamma maññāya dhamma anudhamma ppaṭipannaḥ hoti
translated: But he has not penetrated the meaning of those teachings with wisdom. He does not practice in accordance with the teachings.

original: Evaṁ puggalo appassuto hoti sutena anupapanno.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ appassutaḥ hoti sutena anupapannaḥ
translated: This is how a person is unlearned, not in accordance with what he has learned.

original: Kathañca puggalo appassuto hoti sutena upapanno?
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ appassutaḥ hoti sutena upapanno
translated: “And how is a person learned, in accordance with what he has learned?

original: Idhekaccassa puggalassa appakaṁ sutaṁ hoti suttaṁ geyyaṁ veyyākaraṇaṁ gāthaṁ udānaṁ itivuttakaṁ jātakaṁ abbhutadhammaṁ vedallaṁ.
analyzed: idha ekaccassa puggalassa appakam sutam hoti suttam geyyam veyyākaraṇam gātham udānam itivuttakam jātakam abbhuta dhammam vedalla
translated: There is the case where a person has heard a little…

original: So tassa appakassa sutassa atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammappaṭipanno hoti.
analyzed: so tassa appakassa sutassa attha maññāya dhamma maññāya dhamma anudhamma ppaṭipannaḥ hoti
translated: But he understands the meaning of what he has heard, understands the teaching, understands the details, understands the sequence of the sequence, understands the meaning and the teaching, and having understood the meaning and the teaching, he practices for the realization of that teaching.

original: Evaṁ puggalo appassuto hoti sutena upapanno.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ appassutaḥ hoti sutena upapanno
translated: This is how a person is little learned but has attained to the fruit of learning.

original: Kathañca puggalo bahussuto hoti sutena anupapanno?🔽Idhekaccassa puggalassa bahukaṁ sutaṁ hoti suttaṁ geyyaṁ veyyākaraṇaṁ gāthaṁ udānaṁ itivuttakaṁ jātakaṁ abbhutadhammaṁ vedallaṁ.
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ bahu ssutaḥ hoti sutena anupapannaḥ  idha ekaccassa puggalassa bahukam sutam hoti suttam geyyam veyyākaraṇam gātham udānam itivuttakam jātakam abbhuta dhammam
translated: “And how is a person much learned but has not attained to the fruit of learning?🔽There is the case where a person has heard much…

original: So tassa bahukassa sutassa na atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammappaṭipanno hoti.
analyzed: so tassa bahukassa sutassa na attha maññāya dhamma maññāya dhamma anudhamma ppaṭipannaḥ hoti
translated: But he does not understand the meaning of what he has heard, does not understand the teaching, does not understand the details, does not understand the sequence of the sequence, does not understand the meaning and the teaching, and having not understood the meaning and the teaching, he does not practice for the realization of that teaching.

original: Evaṁ puggalo bahussuto hoti sutena anupapanno.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ bahu sutaḥ hoti sutena anupapannaḥ
translated: This is how a person is much learned but has not attained to the fruit of learning.

original: Kathañca puggalo bahussuto hoti sutena upapanno?
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ bahu ssutaḥ hoti sutena upapannaḥ
translated: “And how is a person much learned and has attained to the fruit of learning?

original: Idhekaccassa puggalassa bahukaṁ sutaṁ hoti suttaṁ geyyaṁ veyyākaraṇaṁ gāthaṁ udānaṁ itivuttakaṁ jātakaṁ abbhutadhammaṁ vedallaṁ.🔽So tassa bahukassa sutassa atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammappaṭipanno hoti.
analyzed: idha ekaccassa puggalassa bahukam sutam hoti suttam geyyam veyyākaraṇam gātham udānam itivuttakam jātakam abbhuta dhammam  so tassa bahukassa sutassa attha maññāya dhamma maññāya dhamma anudhamma ppaṭipannaḥ hoti
translated: There is the case where a person has heard much, has remembered what he/she has heard, and has accumulated what he/she has remembered.🔽He/she discerns the meaning of what he/she has heard, discerns the Dhamma, discerns the Teaching.

original: Evaṁ puggalo bahussuto hoti sutena upapanno.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ bahu sutaḥ hoti sutena upapannaḥ
translated: This is how a person is well-versed in what he/she has learned, and is endowed with learning.

original: Katamo ca puggalo samaṇamacalo?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo samaṇa macalo
translated: “And which is the person who is a monk only in name?

original: Idhekacco puggalo tiṇṇaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā sotāpanno hoti avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyano.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo tiṇṇam sayojanānam parikkhayā sotāpannaḥ hoti a vinipāta dhammo niyataḥ sambodhi parāyano
translated: There is the case where a person, with the ending of three fetters, is a stream-enterer, no longer subject to directed on the Downfall, headed for awakening.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “samaṇamacalo”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo samaṇa macalo
translated: This is called a person who is a monk only in name.

original: Katamo ca puggalo samaṇapadumo?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo samaṇa padumo
translated: “And which is the person who is a monk only in name, but is a white-lotus monk?

original: Idhekacco puggalo tiṇṇaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā rāgadosamohānaṁ tanuttā sakadāgāmī hoti, sakideva imaṁ lokaṁ āgantvā dukkhassantaṁ karoti.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo tiṇṇam sayojanānam parikkhayā rāga dosa mohānam tanuttā sakadāgāmī hoti sakideva imam lokam āgantvā dukkhassantam karoti
translated: There is the case where a person, with the ending of three fetters, and the weakening of greed, hatred, and delusion, is a once-returner, who — returning only once more to this world — will make an ending to stress.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “samaṇapadumo”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo samaṇa padumo
translated: This is called a person who is a monk only in name, but is a white-lotus monk.

original: Katamo ca puggalo samaṇapuṇḍarīko?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ samaṇa puṇḍarīkaḥ
translated: “And which is the person who is a monk only in name, but is a red-lotus monk?

original: Idhekacco puggalo pañcannaṁ orambhāgiyānaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo pañcannam orambhāgiyānam sayojanānam parikkhayā opapātikaḥ hoti tattha parinibbāyī an āvatti dhammo tasmā lokā
translated: Here someone, with the destruction of the five lower fetters, becomes due to reappear spontaneously in the Pure Abodes and there attain final Nibbana without ever returning from that world.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “samaṇapuṇḍarīko”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo samaṇa puṇḍarīko
translated: This is called a “white lotus” person.

original: Katamo ca puggalo samaṇesu samaṇasukhumālo?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo samaṇesu samaṇa sukhu mālo
translated: And what is a “beautiful flower among ascetics”?

original: Idhekacco puggalo āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati
translated: Here someone, by the destruction of the taints, enters and dwells in the taintless liberation of mind, liberation by wisdom, having realized it for himself right in the here and now.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “samaṇesu samaṇasukhumālo”ti.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo samaṇesu samaṇa sukhu mālā ti
translated: This is called a “beautiful flower among ascetics.”

original: Catukkaniddeso.
analyzed: catukka niddesaḥ
translated: The exposition in fours is finished.
